#summary STEC S.M.A.R.T. attributes

= STEC S.M.A.R.T. attributes =

=== Attributes table ===
|| *ID* || *Hex* || *Name* || *Description* ||
||01||01||Raw Read Error||Count of raw data errors while data from media, including retry errors or data error (uncorrectable).<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||02||02||Throughput Performance||Internally measured average and worst data transfer rate.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||05||05||Reallocated Sector Count||Count of reallocated blocks. This is the count of reallocated  or  remapped  sectors  during  normal operation from the grown defects table.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||09||09||Power On Hours||Number of hours elapsed in the Power-On state.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||12||0C||Power Cycle||Number of power-on events.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||13||0D||Soft Read Error Rate||Number of corrected read errors reported to the operating system.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||100||64||Erase/program cycles||Count of erase program cycles for entire card.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||103||67||Translation Table Rebuild||Power backup fault or internal error resulting in loss of  system unit tables.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||170||AA||Reserved Block Count||Number of reserved spares for bad block handling.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||171||AB||Program Fail Count||Count of flash program failures.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||172||AC||Erase Fail Count||Count of flash erase command failures.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||173||AD||Wear Leveling Count||Worst case erase count.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||174||AE||Unexpected Power Loss||Attribute counts number of unexpected power loss events.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||177||B1||Wear Leveling Count||Worst case erase count.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||178||B2||Unexpected Power Loss||This  attribute is used to count the number of unexpected power loss events.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||180||B4||Reserved Block Count||Number of reserved spares for bad block handling.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||181||B5||Program Fail Count||Count of flash program failures.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||182||B6||Erase Fail Count||Count of flash erase command failures.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||183||B7||Runtime Bad Block||Total number of data blocks with detected, uncorrectable  errors  encountered  during  normal operation.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||184||B8||End-to-end error detection||Tracks the number of end to end internal card data path errors that were detected.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||187||BB||Reported Uncorrectable Errors||Number of uncorrectable errors reported at the interface.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||188||BC||Command Timeout||Tracks the number of command time outs as defined by an active command being interrupted.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||194||C2||Temperature||Temperature of the base casting.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||195||C3||Hardware ECC Recovered||Count of ECC errors encountered and corrected using hardware error correction.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||196||C4||Reallocation Event||Total number of remapping events during normal operation and offline surface scanning.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||197||C5||Current Pending Sector Count||Number of blocks marked suspect due to uncorrectable errors.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||198||C6||Offline Surface Scan||Number of uncorrected errors that occurred during offline scan.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 1]</sup>||
||199||C7||UDMA/SATA CRC Error||Number of CRC errors during UDMA or SATA mode.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||200||C8||Average Wear Leveling||Average number of block erase counts for all blocks on the solid state drive.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
||233||E9||Number of Write Count||Count of write commands originating from the host side.<sup>[STEC_SMART_attributes#Sources 2]</sup>||
